CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Odonnell Laboratory?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Odonnell Laboratory is arc {Adriantown College}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc NIT?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc NIT is arc {Adriantown College}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Parker University} has the largest input flow.

VE.Q: What is the flow value from Odonnell Laboratory to NIT in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from NIT to Herman Research Center in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Parker University and NIT in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Parker University and NIT is {92}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between Herman Research Center and NIT in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between Herman Research Center and NIT is {22}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value in the chord chart?
What is the minimum flow value in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from Herman Research Center?
SC.A: The total flow output from Herman Research Center is {45}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by Herman Research Center?
SC.A: The total flow input by Herman Research Center is {36}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 66? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {92} from {NIT} to {Parker University}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 7? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {6} from {Parker University} to {Odonnell Laboratory}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 11 and 15? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {14} from {Odonnell Laboratory} to {Herman Research Center}, a flow of {12} from {Adriantown College} to {NIT}, a flow of {11} from {NIT} to {Adriantown College}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from NIT to Parker University or from Odonnell Laboratory to NIT?
NC.A: The flow from {NIT} to {Parker University} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Herman Research Center to NIT, from Herman Research Center to Odonnell Laboratory, or from Odonnell Laboratory to NIT?
NC.A: The flow from {Herman Research Center} to {NIT} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {NIT}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {NIT} and {Parker University}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc NIT, Arc Parker University, Arc Herman Research Center, Arc Odonnell Laboratory, Arc Adriantown College}.
